title: Hardball Questions For The Next Debate (2020)
summary:
Key ideas:
- Scott asks hardball questions to each presidential candidate.
- Questions focus on controversial or personal issues, rather than policy.
- Humorous elements are used in each question.

Key learnings:
- Questions aimed at tripping up candidates can draw attention away from policy and important issues.
- Humorous elements can make hardball questions more approachable.

Key questions:
- Mr. Biden: If your son had been a daughter, would you have named her Gatherer?
- Mr. Bloomberg: What makes you so sure you’re not in Hell already?
- Mayor Buttigieg: Is your campaign just the setup for a gay porno?
- Senator Warren: Is your campaign is just a publicity stunt to raise interest in genetic testing?
- Senator Sanders: It’s been four years. How many birds would have to land on Donald Trump before you admit he would make a better president than you?
- Mr. Yang: Do you think a good slogan for your campaign would be “Semper ubi sub ubi”?
